intro: Echites brachylobus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echites, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid regions. Echites brachylobus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
